question_text: Why might a DisplayPort-to-HDMI passive adapter work in one direction but not the other?
answer_options: Passive adapters only convert HDMI audio, not video
DisplayPort sends HDMI-compatible signals but HDMI does not send DisplayPort-compatible signals
The adapter rewires pins and changes the voltage levels automatically
correct_answer: DisplayPort sends HDMI-compatible signals but HDMI does not send DisplayPort-compatible signals
explanation: DisplayPort can output a compatible HDMI signal for use with passive adapters, but HDMI cannot generate a DisplayPort-compatible output without active conversion.
